being presented, on request of any member of the board of trustees.
§ 2-14 DECORUM.
   Members of the board of trustees desiring to discuss a question shall
address the president, and no member shall be deemed to have the floor until
recognized by the president. No person except the president or a trustee shall
be permitted to address the board unless by unanimous consent of the members
present.
§ 2-15 ROBERT'S RULES OF ORDER.
   The village president shall decide all questions of order and be governed in
his or her decisions by parliamentary law, as prescribed in Robert's Rules of
Order, as revised.
ARTICLE III. OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES GENERALLY
Division 1. Village President
§ 2-16 CHIEF EXECUTIVE OF VILLAGE, ETC.
   (a)   The village president shall be chief executive of the village and
shall perform all such duties as may be required of him or her by statute, this
code or other village ordinance.
   (b)   He or she shall have the power to settle disputes as to the
jurisdiction of the various officers and employees of the village.
§ 2-17 POWERS AND DUTIES GENERALLY.
   The village president shall have such powers and perform such duties as may
be provided by statute, the provisions of this code or other ordinances of the
village.
§ 2-18 BOND.
   The village president shall file such bond as may be required by the board
of trustees.
(1929 Code, § 17)
§ 2-19 TO ATTEND MEETINGS OF BOARD, ETC.
   The village president shall attend all regular and special meetings of the
board of trustees, and shall preside thereat. He or she shall have a vote only
in case of a tie.
(1929 Code, § 18)
Division 2. Village Manager
§ 2-20 OFFICE CREATED.
   There is hereby created the office of village manager, an administrative
office of the village.
§ 2-21 APPOINTMENT, TERM, QUALIFICATIONS, ETC.
   (a)   The village manager shall be appointed by majority vote of the board
of trustees for an indefinite term.
   (b)   The board shall choose him or her solely on the basis of his or her
executive and administrative qualifications with special reference to his or
her actual experience in or his or her knowledge of accepted practice in
respect to the duties of his or her office hereinafter set forth.
   (c)   At the time of his or her appointment, he or she need not be a
resident of the village or state, but during his or her tenure of office he or
she shall reside within the village unless the board of trustees of the village
expressly agrees otherwise.
(Ord. No. 97-3-2026)
   (d)   No village trustee shall receive such appointment during the term for
which he or she shall have been elected or within one year after the expiration
of his or her term.
§ 2-22 BOND.
   The village manager shall furnish a surety bond to be approved by the board
of trustees, such bond to be conditioned on the faithful performance of his or
her duties. The village shall pay the premium of such bond.
§ 2-23 COMPENSATION.
   The village manager shall receive compensation in such amount and manner as
the board of trustees shall fix from time to time.
§ 2-24 REMOVAL FROM OFFICE.
   (a)   At-will employment. The board of trustees may remove the village
manager at any time by a majority vote of its members. The term of the village
manager's employment by the village shall be at the will and desire of the
village board and shall not be for a fixed or stated term. Nothing in the terms
of this code or in any employment agreement with the village manager shall
prevent, limit or otherwise interfere with the right of the village board to
terminate the services of the village manager at any time. The village manager
shall have no property or any other right to a continuation of employment as
village manager.
   (b)   Severance provisions.
      (1)   In the event that the board of trustees removes the village manager
during such time as the village manager is willing and able to perform the
duties of village manager, and provided that the village manager has not
breached any provision of any employment agreement that may have been reached
with the village, and provided further that the village manager has not been
convicted of any felony or any crime involving moral turpitude, the village
board shall exercise one of the following two severance options:
         A.   The board may deliver to the village manager a written notice of
termination that will allow the village manager to serve as a consultant of the
village for a period of six months with all the salary, health, dental, life
insurance and pension benefits provided at the same level as at the time of
such notice. In addition, within 15 days after delivery of such notice of
termination, the village manager shall be entitled to receive in a lump sum
payment the cash value of 100% of his or her accrued and unused sick days as of
the date of delivery of such notice of termination. In his or her role of
consultant as herein described, the village manager shall only perform those
duties as established by the board of trustees, notwithstanding any provision
to the contrary in this code or Illinois statutes; or
         B.   The board may deliver to the village manager a written notice of
termination that will entitle the village manager to receive within 15 days
after delivery of such notice a lump sum cash payment in an amount equal to the
value of six months of the salary, health, dental, life insurance and pension
benefits provided at the time of such notice, plus the cash value of 100% of
his or her accrued and unused vacation days and 50% of his or her accrued and
unused sick days as of the date of delivery of such notice of termination.
(Ord. No. 91-21-1863)
      (2)   The severance option chosen by the board shall constitute the full
extent of the village's liability to the village manager resulting from his or
her employment as village manager, unless expressly modified by an employment
agreement between the village and the village manager.
   (c)   Reduction in salary. In the event that the village at any time reduces
the village manager's salary by a greater percentage than an applicable across-
the-board reduction for village employees, the village manager may, at his or
her option, declare his or her removal as village manager and be entitled to
the severance provisions provided in subsection
2-24(b) above.
   (d)   Voluntary termination. In the event that the village manager desires
to resign, he or she shall deliver a written notice of termination to the board
not less than 90 days prior to the effective day of his or her resignation, and
he or she shall not be entitled to any of the severance provisions provided
herein.
   (e)   Termination by death. Notwithstanding anything in this §
2-24 to the contrary, in the event of the village manager's death, any
employment agreement in force between the village and the village manager shall
terminate automatically and without any resulting liability of the village to
the village manager or his or her estate, except as provided in subsection
2-24(f) below.
   (f)   Vacation and sick pay. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in
subsections
2-24(d) and
2-24(e) above, in the event the village manager resigns, or in the event of the
village manager's death, the village manager or his or her estate shall be
entitled to the full cash value of 100% of any of his or her accrued and unused
vacation days and 50% of any of his or her accrued and unused sick days as of
the date of such resignation or death.
(Ord. No. 91-21-1863)
§ 2-25 POWERS AND DUTIES GENERALLY.
   The village manager shall be the chief administrative officer of the
village. He or she may head one or more departments and shall be responsible to
the board of trustees for the proper administration of all affairs of the
village. To that end, he or she shall have power and shall be required to:
   (a)   Appoint and, when necessary for the good of the service, suspend or
remove all officers and employees of the village, except as he or she may
authorize the head of a department or office to appoint, suspend or remove
subordinates in such department or office;
   (b)   Prepare the budget annually and submit it to the board of trustees
together with a message describing the important features and be responsible
for its administration after adoption;
   (c)   Keep the board of trustees advised of the financial condition and
future needs of the village, and make such recommendations as he or she may
deem desirable;
   (d)   Recommend to the board of trustees a standard schedule of pay for each
appointive office and position in the village service;
   (e)   Recommend to the board of trustees from time to time adoption of such
measures as he or she may deem necessary or expedient for the health, safety or
welfare of the community or for the improvement of administrative services;
   (f)   Consolidate or combine offices, positions, departments or units under
his or her jurisdiction, with the approval of the board of trustees;
   (g)   Attend all meetings of the board of trustees unless excused therefrom
and take part in the discussion of all matters coming before the board of
trustees;
   (h)   Supervise the purchase of all materials, supplies and equipment for
which funds are provided in the budget in accordance with the village’s
purchasing policy, duly adopted pursuant to § 2-82 of this code; let contracts
necessary for operation or maintenance of village services for amounts up to
and including $25,000, authorize the procurement of goods, supplies, and
equipment in amounts up to and including $25,000, and advise the board of
trustees on the advantages or disadvantages of contract and bid proposals. No
purchase shall be made, contract let or obligation incurred for any item or
service which exceeds the current appropriation without a supplemental
appropriation by the board of trustees. No contract or procurement requiring an
aggregate expenditure in excess of $25,000 and no contract for new construction
shall be let except with the approval of the board of trustees as set forth in
the village’s purchasing policy;
   (i)   See that all laws and ordinances are duly enforced;
   (j)   Investigate all complaints in relation to matters concerning the
administration of the government of the village, and in regard to service
maintained by the public utilities in the village, and see that all franchises,
permits and privileges granted by the village are faithfully observed;
   (k)   Devote his or her entire time to the discharge of his or her official
duties; and
   (l)   Perform such other duties as may be required by the board of trustees,
not inconsistent with the charter, law or ordinances.
   (m)   Establish and administer policies and procedures for purposes of
determining whether an employee or former employee is eligible to receive
benefits pursuant to the Public Safety Employee Benefits Act (820 ILCS 320/1 et
seq.) (“PSEBA”).
(Ord. No. 2017-23-3431; Ord. No. 2020-08-3474)
§ 2-26 ABSENCE FROM VILLAGE, ETC.
   In the event that the village manager shall be absent from the village or
incapacitated from performing the duties of his or her position, he or she
shall appoint a member of the staff to act as manager during his or her absence
or incapacity.
§ 2-27 BOARD NOT TO INTERFERE WITH APPOINTMENTS OR REMOVALS, ETC.
   (a)   Neither the board of trustees nor any of its members shall direct or
request the appointment of any person to, or his or her removal from, office by
the village manager or any of his or her subordinates, or in any manner take
part in the appointment or removal of officers and employees in the
administrative services of the village.
   (b)   Except for the purpose of inquiry, the board of trustees and its
members shall deal with the administrative service solely through the village
manager and neither the board of trustees nor any member thereof shall give
orders to any subordinates of the village manager, either publicly or
privately.
Division 3. Village Treasurer
§ 2-28 OFFICE CREATED.
   There is hereby created the office of village treasurer.
(1929 Code, § 64)
§ 2-29 APPOINTMENT.
   The president and board of trustees shall appoint the village treasurer.
(1929 Code, § 65)
§ 2-30 COMPENSATION; BOND.
   The village treasurer shall serve without compensation, but shall furnish a
surety bond to be approved by the board of trustees, with the premium for such
bond to be paid by the village.
§ 2-31 DUTIES GENERALLY.
   The village treasurer shall have custody of all village funds, shall deposit
such funds in such depositories as are specified from time to time by the board
of trustees and shall perform such other duties as may be required by statute,
this code or other village ordinance.
(1929 Code, § 67)
§ 2-32 VILLAGE WARRANTS.
   The village treasurer shall not recognize or pay any claim excepting upon a
warrant or voucher signed by the village president and the village clerk. All
such warrants shall specify the particular fund or appropriation to which they
are chargeable, and the person to whom payable.
(1929 Code, § 68) (Ord. No. 87-8-1746)
§ 2-33 RECEIPT OF INTEREST AND MONEY.
   The village treasurer shall receive all interest on village funds due from
depositories or from other sources and shall receive all monies belonging to
the village. All such monies shall be credited to the proper accounts of the
village.
§ 2-34 MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND ACCOUNTS; REPORTS.
   The village treasurer shall keep such books and accounts as may be required
by the village manager or by the board of trustees, and shall render monthly
reports showing the state of the treasury at the termination of the month, and
such other reports as may be required by the board of trustees.
Division 4. Village Clerk
§ 2-35 APPOINTMENT; TERM.
   The village president and the board of trustees shall appoint a village
clerk, who shall hold his or her office for the term of two years from and
after the first regular meeting of the board of trustees in the month of May of
the year in which he or she shall be appointed and until his or her successor
shall be appointed and shall have qualified.
(1929 Code, art. I, § 21)
§ 2-36 COMPENSATION; BOND.
   The village clerk shall serve without compensation, but shall furnish a
surety bond to be approved by the board of trustees, with the premium for such
bond to be paid by the village.
§ 2-37 POWERS AND DUTIES GENERALLY.
   (a)   The village clerk shall be ex officio clerk of the board of trustees
and in addition to the duties required to be performed by the clerk of the
board as set forth in the charter of the village, it shall be the duty of the
village clerk to keep his or her office at the village hall and to make copies
of all ordinances, resolutions and other papers duly filed in his or her office
and transcripts from the journals and other records and files of his or her
office, certified by him or her under the corporate seal, to be furnished to
any of the trustees or officers of the village without the payment of any fee
therefor, and to be furnished to all other persons upon the payment of the fee
therefor prescribed by ordinance.
   (b)   It shall also be the duty of the village clerk to perform such other
duties and functions as may be prescribed by the board of trustees.
§ 2-38 POSTING, ETC., OF ORDINANCES.
   The village clerk, in a book to be kept for that purpose, before the next
regular meeting after their passage shall record all ordinances passed by the
board of trustees of the village. The village clerk shall also post copies of
such ordinances in three of the most public places in the village, as
designated by ordinance, and not later than 30 days after the passage thereof,
and shall note at the foot of the record of each ordinance a memorandum showing
the date of the passage and approval of such ordinance and the date of posting
such ordinance after the passage thereof.
§ 2-39 DOCKETING AND FILING DOCUMENTS.
   It shall be the duty of the village clerk to number, docket and file in
regular order all official documents coming into his or her custody and control
as such officer, indexing the same in such a manner that they can be readily
referred to at all times.
(1929 Code, § 25)
§ 2-40 NOTIFICATION OF PERSONS OF ELECTION OR APPOINTMENT.
   It shall be the duty of the village clerk within five days after the result
of any election is declared or appointment made, to notify all persons elected
or appointed to any village office of their election or appointment; and unless
such persons shall respectively qualify within ten days after such notice, the
respective offices shall thereby become vacant.
(1929 Code, § 26)
Division 5. Village Attorney
§ 2-41 OFFICE CREATED; APPOINTMENT.
   There is hereby created the office of village attorney. The village
president and board of trustees shall appoint the village attorney.
§ 2-42 COMPENSATION.
   The village attorney shall receive such compensation as may be fixed by the
village president and board of trustees.
(1929 Code, § 51)
§ 2-43 TERM OF OFFICE.
   The village attorney shall hold office for the term of one year, and until
his or her successor shall be appointed and qualified. He or she shall be
appointed upon the first regular meeting of the board of trustees in the month
of May of each year or as soon thereafter as may be.
(1929 Code, § 49)
§ 2-44 DUTIES.
   The village attorney shall superintend and conduct all law business of the
village, excepting local improvements or condemnation proceedings, or either
prepare and draft ordinances and legal documents and render legal opinions when
requested by the village president or board of trustees on all questions
concerning the village interests; attend the meetings of the president and
board of trustees when required; make reports from time to time and otherwise
perform such other duties or special services within the county which the
president and board of trustees may require.
(1929 Code, § 50)
§ 2-45 VACANCY.
   Appointment of the president and board of trustees shall fill vacancies in
the office of village attorney.
(1929 Code, § 52)
§ 2-46 SPECIAL COUNSEL.
   The board of trustees may, by a majority vote of its members, employ
attorneys to conduct all legal matters pertaining to the making of local
improvements, the assessment and confirmation of special assessments and the
collection of the same and condemnation proceedings. It may also, by majority
vote, employ attorneys to assist the village attorney in any legal matter or
proceeding, or to conduct any particular legal matter or proceeding.
(1929 Code, § 52a)
Division 6. Village Collector
§ 2-47 APPOINTMENT; TERM.
   The president and the board of trustees shall appoint a village collector,
who shall hold his or her office for the term of one year from and after the
first regular meeting of the board of trustees in the month of May of the year
in which he or she shall be appointed and until his or her successor shall be
appointed and shall have qualified.
(1929 Code, § 28)
§ 2-48 BOND.
   The village collector shall file such bond with the village clerk before
entering upon the duties of his or her office as may be required by the board
of trustees.
(1929 Code, § 29)
§ 2-49 DUTIES.
   The village collector shall perform such duties as may be required of him or
her by the village charter, or by any other statute or by this code or other
village ordinance.
(1929 Code, § 30)
§ 2-50 REPORTS AND RECORDS.
   The village collector shall make such reports and keep such records as may
be required from time to time by the board of trustees.
(1929 Code, § 31)
§ 2-51 VACANCY.
   In case of the village collector's office becoming vacant, the president and
board of trustees shall appoint a successor to serve out the term, as is
provided by
§ 1 of article III of the village charter.
(1929 Code, § 32)
Division 7. Village Prosecutor
§ 2-52 OFFICE CREATED.
   There is hereby created the office of village prosecutor, an administrative
office of the village.
(Ord. No. 1415)
§ 2-53 APPOINTMENT.
   The village manager shall appoint the village prosecutor.
(Ord. No. 1415)
§ 2-54 DUTIES.
   It shall be the duty of the village prosecutor to prepare and prosecute all
suits or actions involving violations of this code or other village ordinances
and of the statutes of the state, which are authorized by law to be instituted
before the police magistrate of the village. The village prosecutor is
authorized to prosecute misdemeanor offenses if enumerated both under this code
and a statute of the state pursuant to the authority granted by § 1-21.1 of the
Illinois Municipal Code (65ILCS 5/1-2-1.1) and the Village’s police powers. The
village prosecutor shall also furnish legal advice to the officers of the
police department of the village, to other members of the village organization
and to the general public interested in suits or actions within the
jurisdiction of the village. The village prosecutor shall file a written
monthly report with the village manager containing information concerning the
work of his or her office during the preceding month.
(Ord. No. 1415; Ord. 2024-14-3591)
§ 2-55 COMPENSATION.
   The village manager with the approval of the board of trustees shall fix the
salary of the village prosecutor.
(Ord. No. 1415)
§ 2-56 VACANCY.
   Vacancies in the office of village prosecutor shall be filled by appointment
of the village manager.
(Ord. No. 1415)
Division 8. Street Commissioner
§ 2-57 APPOINTMENT; TERM.
   Pursuant to § 3-8-2 of the Illinois Municipal Code and notwithstanding any
provision of the village charter of the contrary, the village president and
board of trustees shall appoint a street commissioner, who shall hold his or
her office for the term of one year from and after the first regular meeting of
the board of trustees in the month of May of each year or as soon thereafter as
possible and until his or her successor shall be appointed and qualified.
(Ord. No. 85-16-1721)
§ 2-58 BOND.
   The street commissioner shall file bond with the village clerk before
entering upon the duties of his or her office as may be required by the board
of trustees.
§ 2-59 DUTIES.
   The street commissioner shall perform such duties as may be required of him
or her by the village charter or any other statute or by this code or other
village ordinance.
§ 2-60 REPORTS AND RECORDS.
   The street commissioner shall make such reports and keep such records as may
be required from time to time by the board of trustees.
§ 2-61 VACANCY.
   Vacancies in the office of street commissioner shall be filled by
appointment of the president and board of trustees.
(Ord. No. 85-16-1721)
Division 9. Village Marshal
§ 2-62 APPOINTMENT; TERM.
   The village president and board of trustees shall appoint a village marshal,
who shall hold his or her office for the term of one year from and after the
first regular meeting of the board of trustees in the month of May of the year
in which he or she shall be appointed and until his or her successor shall be
appointed and shall have qualified.
(Ord. No. 1278)
§ 2-63 BOND.
   The village marshal shall file such bond with the village clerk before
entering upon the duties of his or her office as may be required by the board
of trustees.
§ 2-64 DUTIES.
   The village marshal shall perform such duties as may be required of him or
her by the village charter, or by any other statute or by this code or other
village ordinance.
§ 2-65 REPORTS AND RECORDS.
   The village marshal shall make such reports and keep such records as may be
required from time to time by the board of trustees.
§ 2-66 VACANCY.
   In case of the village marshal's office becoming vacant, the president and
the board of trustees shall appoint a successor to serve out the term, as is
provided by
§ 1 of article III of the village charter.
Division 10. Police Constable
§ 2-67 ELECTION.
   There shall be elected a police constable, as is provided by
§ 1 of article III of the village charter.
§ 2-68 BOND.
   The police constable shall file such bond with the village clerk before
entering upon the duties of his or her office as may be required by the board
of trustees.
§ 2-69 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The police constable shall have such powers and perform such duties as may
be required of him or her by the village charter or by any other statute or by
this code or other village ordinance.
§ 2-70 REPORTS AND RECORDS.
   The police constable shall make such reports and keep such records as may be
required from time to time by the board of trustees.
§ 2-71 VACANCY.
   In case of the police constable's office becoming vacant, the president and
the board of trustees shall appoint a successor to serve out the term, as is
provided by
§ 1 of article III of the village charter.
§ 2-72 NEGLIGENCE OR VIOLATION OF DUTY.
   For negligence or violation of duty, the police constable shall be subject
to the penalties provided by
§ 9 of article III of the village charter.
ARTICLE IV. VILLAGE DEPARTMENTS
Division 1. Department of Public Works
§ 2-73 CREATION; COMPOSITION.
   There is hereby created the department of public works, an administrative
department of the village. This department shall consist of a director of
public works and such other officers and employees as may be provided from time
to time by the board of trustees.
§ 2-74 DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC WORKS - OFFICE CREATED; APPOINTMENT.
   There is hereby created the office of director of public works, an
administrative office of the village. The director of public works shall be
appointed by the village manager.
Cross-reference:
   As to approval of premises for public amusements by director of public
works, see §
5-11
§ 2-75 SAME - COMPENSATION.
   The salary of the director of public works shall be fixed by the village
manager with the approval of the board of trustees.
§ 2-76 SAME - POWERS AND DUTIES.
   (a)   The director of public works shall have charge of the maintenance of
all public streets, alleys, roads, bridges, culverts, sidewalks and other
structures pertaining thereto in the village.
   (b)   He or she shall have charge of the operation and maintenance of all
public sewers and drains in the village.
   (c)   He or she shall have charge of the maintenance of trees located in the
public streets and upon other public property.
   (d)   He or she shall have charge of all buildings, grounds and equipment
belonging to the village, except that which is expressly delegated to the
supervision of other officers and departments.
   (e)   He or she shall have charge of the collection and disposal of garbage,
ashes, rubbish and other waste.
   (f)   He or she shall supervise the construction, erection, alteration,
maintenance, repair, removal and inspection of all buildings, walls, structures
or portions thereof, and all accessories thereto, within the village, and shall
enforce all provisions of this code and other ordinances relating thereto.
   (g)   He or she shall supervise the construction, installation, alteration,
repair and inspection of all plumbing installations and house connections to
sewers within the village, and shall enforce all provisions of this code and
other ordinances relating thereto.
   (h)   He or she shall supervise the construction, erection, installation,
alteration, repair, removal and inspection of all tanks or containers for the
storage or use of inflammable liquids and equipment for the use and sale of
inflammable liquids within the village, as regulated by this code.
   (i)   He or she shall issue all permits provided by the building, plumbing,
electrical and zoning regulations of the village and shall perform such other
specific duties as are provided therein.
   (j)   He or she shall appoint and remove such employees, inspectors and
assistants as he or she may require, and prescribe the duties thereof subject
to the approval of the village manager.
   (k)   He or she shall perform the duties of village engineer.
   (l)   He or she shall supervise the regulation of the installation,
alteration and use of all electrical equipment.
   (m)   He or she shall have charge of the village waterworks and water
distribution system and all property pertaining thereto. He or she shall manage
and operate the village waterworks and shall be responsible for the efficiency
thereof.
   (n)   He or she shall enforce all ordinances, rules and regulations relating
to the operation of the department of public works.
   (o)   He or she shall perform such other duties as may be assigned by the
village manager.
Division 2. Department of Finance
§ 2-77 CREATION; COMPOSITION.
   There is hereby created the Department of Finance, an administrative
department of the village. The Department of Finance shall consist of a
Director of Finance and such other officers and employees as may be provided
from time to time by the Board of Trustees.
(Ord. No. 2017-23-3431)
§ 2-78 DIRECTOR OF FINANCE - OFFICE CREATED; APPOINTMENT.
   There is hereby created the Office of Director of Finance, an Administrative
Office of the village. The Director of Finance shall be appointed by the
Village Manager.
(Ord. No. 2017-23-3431)
§ 2-79 SAME - COMPENSATION.
   The salary of the Director of Finance shall be fixed by the Village Manager
with the approval of the Board of Trustees.
(Ord. No. 2017-23-3431)
§ 2-80 SAME - DUTIES GENERALLY; SUPERVISION BY VILLAGE MANAGER.
   (a)   The Director of Finance shall be head of the Department of Finance,
and in addition to the duties required by state law he or she shall have the
following duties, functions and responsibilities:
      (1)    Preparation of proposed annual budgets, appropriation ordinances
and tax levy ordinances;
      (2)   Supervision of expenditures;
      (3)   Maintenance of all financial records of the village;
      (4)   Centralized purchasing covering all purchases by the village in
accordance with the village's purchasing policies;
      (5)   Preparation of financial reports and statements;
      (6)   Personnel administration, particularly as it relates to
recruitment, position classification and salary administration; and
      (7)   Billing and collection of bills for water utility use and other
services rendered by the village.
   (b)   The Director of Finance, in performance of his or her duties, shall be
subject to the control and direction of the Village Manager. He or she shall
perform such other services, within or without the Department of Finance, as
may be required by the Village Manager.
(Ord. No. 2017-23-3431)
§ 2-81 SAME - PURCHASING COORDINATOR.
   The Director of Finance shall be ex officio Purchasing Coordinator for the
village, and shall purchase all supplies, services and materials for use in all
departments of the village upon the requisition of the proper officer of the
department requiring same, and upon approval of the Village Manager and in
compliance with the village's purchasing policy. The Purchasing Coordinator
shall be responsible for the dissemination and enforcement of the purchasing
policy and shall from time to time recommend appropriate amendments and updates
to the purchasing policy.
(Ord. No. 2017-23-3431)
§ 2-82 PURCHASING POLICY.
   (a)   The purchasing and contracting for goods and services shall be
governing by a purchasing policy adopted by the Village Board of Trustees. The
purchasing policy shall govern the means of and standards for:
      (1)   The solicitation of quotes, bids, and proposals;
      (2)   The selection of responsible bidders and qualified proposers;
      (3)   The award of contracts to selected bidders and proposers.
   (b)   The purchasing policy shall conform to, and incorporate by reference,
all applicable state laws regarding the procurement of goods and services by
the village. The purchasing policy may be amended by resolution of the Village
Board of Trustees duly adopted.
(Ord. No. 2017-23-3431)
Division 3. Department of Public Safety
§ 2-84 CREATION; COMPOSITION.
   There is hereby created a department of public safety, an administrative
department of the village. The department of public safety shall consist of a
director of public safety, two deputy chiefs of public safety and such other
members and non-sworn employees as may be authorized by the board of trustees.
For the purpose of applying the provisions of the Board of Fire and Police
Commissioners Act, 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-1 et seq., the department of public safety
shall be considered a regularly-constituted police department and a regularly
constituted fire department.
(Ord. No. 90-5-1814; Ord. No. 2001-11-3028)
§ 2-85 DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC SAFETY - OFFICE CREATED.
   There is hereby created the office of director of public safety, an
administrative office of the village. The director of public safety is and
shall serve as the chief of police and fire chief of the village. The director
of public safety shall be appointed by the village manager and shall serve
until such time as he or she resigns or is removed or discharged by the village
manager; provided, however, that no such removal or discharge shall become
effective unless confirmed by a majority of the corporate authorities in
accordance with the provisions of Ill. Rev. Stat. ch. 24, § 10-2.1-4.
(Ord. No. 90-5-1814)
§ 2-86 SAME - COMPENSATION.
   The salary of the director of public safety shall be fixed by the village
manager with the approval of the board of trustees.
§ 2-87 SAME - POWERS AND DUTIES.
   (a)   The director of public safety shall have charge and control over the
department of public safety, and shall be responsible for the faithful and
efficient conduct and operation of the department, including police, fire and
emergency medical service operations.
   (b)   He or she shall enforce all provisions of this code and other
ordinances of the village and all statutes and laws effective in the village;
shall appoint the deputy chiefs of public safety; shall preserve order and
prevent infractions of the law and arrest violators thereof; shall mitigate the
results and render aid in the case of accident or disaster; shall prevent and
extinguish accidental or destructive fires; and shall perform such other duties
in the preservation of life and property as may be assigned by the village
manager; shall be the keeper of the village jail and shall have custody of all
persons incarcerated therein; shall have custody of all apparatus and property
pertaining to the public safety responsibilities of the department; and shall
keep such records and make such reports as may be required by the village
manager. He or she shall have the power to appoint and remove non-sworn
employees of the department, to adopt rules to govern the operation of the
department and the conduct of its members and employees, to determine by rule
the title and order or rank of positions within the department, to designate
which positions within the department are entry level positions, which are
promotional positions and which are duty assignment positions and to fix the
duties of all members and employees of the department, all subject to approval
of the village manager.
(Ord. No. 90-5-1814; Ord. No. 2001-11-3028)
   (c)   In addition, the director of public safety shall have power to assign
members of the department, for the purpose of training and improvement in their
knowledge and efficiency, to attend training schools and other training
facilities outside the village. Members of the department who may be so
assigned shall be considered as being on duty in the same manner as though
assigned to duty at the village public safety department.
(Ord. No. 90-5-1814)
§ 2-88 DEPUTY CHIEFS - POWERS AND DUTIES.
   Two deputy chiefs of public safety shall be appointed by the director of
public safety from any rank of sworn, full-time members of the department of
public safety and must have at least five years of full-time service as a
member in the department. The deputy chiefs of public safety shall be an exempt
rank immediately below that of the director of public safety. The deputy chiefs
of public safety shall serve at the discretion of the director of public safety
and, if removed from the position, shall revert to the rank held immediately
prior to appointment to the position of deputy chief of public safety.
(Ord. No. 2001-11-3028)
§§ 2-89 - 2-90  REPEALED.
(Ord. No. 90-5-1814)
§ 2-91 POWERS AND DUTIES OF MEMBERS GENERALLY.
   (a)   It shall be the duty of the members of the department of public safety
to enforce all of the provisions of this code and other ordinances of the
village and all statutes and laws effective in the village; to preserve order
and prevent infractions of the law and to arrest violators thereof; to mitigate
the results and render aid in the case of accident or disaster; to prevent and
extinguish accidental or destructive fires, and to perform such other duties in
the preservation of life and property as may be assigned.
   (b)   Every member of the department is hereby declared to be a conservator
of the peace.
   (c)   All members of the department shall be authorized to serve writs,
summonses and other processes.
   (d)   Each member of the department shall have all the responsibility,
authority and liability prescribed by statute or ordinance for police officers
or firefighters; provided, however, that this provision shall not, from and
after March 1, 1982, be construed to disqualify members of the department from
being considered as "full-time police officers" or "full-time firefighters" for
purposes of the application of Ill. Rev. Stat. ch. 24, § 10-2.1-26.
§ 2-92 APPOINTMENT AND DISCIPLINE OF MEMBERS.
   From and after March 1, 1982, the appointment, promotion, discipline,
removal and discharge of members of the department of public safety, other than
the director and the two deputy chiefs, shall be in accordance with the Board
of Fire and Police Commissioners Act, 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-1 et seq., and the rules
and regulations of the public safety commissioners of the Village of Glencoe
established pursuant to division 7 of this article V of this chapter.
(Ord. No. 90-5-1814; Ord. No. 2001-11-3028)
§ 2-93 ACCEPTANCE OF GIFTS.
   No member of the department of public safety shall, for his or her own
benefit, share in any present, gift or emolument for public safety services
without the consent of the village manager.
§ 2-94 DUTY TO REPORT DELIVERY OF SEIZED PROPERTY, ETC.
   It shall be the duty of every member of the department of public safety to
report to the director of public safety at such times and places as may be
required, at all times to obey the orders and instructions of the director of
public safety, and also to deliver to the director of public safety all
property seized or found by them immediately after the same shall come into
their possession, which property, with the date of delivery and a description
of the same, and name of the member, shall be entered in a book to be kept for
the purpose by the director of public safety or his or her designee.
§ 2-95 BADGE TO BE WORN, ETC.
   Every member of the department of public safety shall wear a suitable badge
to be furnished by the village. Any member of the public safety department who
shall destroy his or her badge, or any other article issued him or her by the
village shall be required to pay the cost of replacing it.
§ 2-96 DUTY OF MEMBERS TO RETURN PROPERTY ISSUED BY THE VILLAGE UPON
RESIGNATION, ETC.
   Whenever any member of the department of public safety shall leave, resign,
be suspended or discharged, he or she shall immediately deliver his or her
badge and all other property of the village issued to him or her to the
director of public safety and any pay due or to become due such member shall be
withheld until such property has been returned.
Division 4. Fire Department
§ 2-97 DUTIES OF CITIZENS.
   It shall be the duty of all persons when called upon by a member of the
department of public safety to promptly aid and assist the officer in the
discharge of his or her duties.
§ 2-98 CREATION; COMPOSITION.
   There is hereby created a fire department, an administrative department of
the village. The fire department shall consist of a director of public safety,
chief of police and fire chief and such other members as may be authorized by
the board of trustees.
(Ord. No. 90-5-1814)
§§ 2-99 - 2-101 REPEALED.
(Ord. No. 90-5-1814)
§ 2-102 POWERS AND DUTIES OF MEMBERS.
   (a)   It shall be the duty of the members of the fire department to prevent
and extinguish accidental or destructive fires; to mitigate the results and
render aid in the case of accident or disaster; to preserve order and prevent
infractions of the law and to arrest violators thereof; to enforce all the
provisions of this code and other ordinances of the village and all statutes
and laws effective in the village, and to perform such other duties in the
preservation of life and property as may be assigned.
   (b)   All members of the fire department shall be authorized to serve writs,
summonses and other processes.
   (c)   Each member of the department shall have all the responsibility,
authority and liability prescribed by statute, this code or other village
ordinances for firefighters or police officers.
Division 5. Health Department
§ 2-103 CREATION; COMPOSITION.
   There is hereby created the department of health, an administrative
department of the village. This department shall consist of the health officer
and such other members as may be authorized by the board of trustees.
§ 2-104 HEALTH OFFICER - OFFICE CREATED.
   There is hereby created the office of health officer, an administrative
office of the village.
§ 2-105 SAME - APPOINTMENT; QUALIFICATIONS.
   The village manager shall appoint as health officer a person suitable
trained or experienced in public health administration.
§ 2-106 SAME - GENERAL NATURE OF OFFICE.
   The health officer shall be head of the department of health and shall be
responsible to the village manager for the efficient administration of this
department.
§ 2-107 SAME - COMPENSATION.
   The salary of the health officer and his or her deputies and employees, if
not otherwise provided for, shall be fixed by the village manager with the
approval of the board of trustees.
§ 2-108 SAME - POWERS AND DUTIES.
   It shall be the duty of the health officer and his or her duly authorized
deputies to execute and enforce all statutes of the state, provisions of this
code and other ordinances of the village, and regulations and rules of the
board of health, relating to health, and to take such other action as is
necessary for the determination of the status of and the promotion and
improvement of the public health, not inconsistent with the foregoing statutes,
ordinances, rules and regulations. The health officer shall have the power to
appoint and remove and to fix the duties of his or her deputies and other
employees of the health department, subject to the approval of the village
manager.
§ 2-109 SAME - NOTICE OF VIOLATIONS AND PROCEDURE FOR PROSECUTION OF VIOLATORS.
   When it appears that any health ordinance or regulation of the board of
health has been violated, the health officer shall cause notice of such fact to
be given to the person concerned, who shall be given an opportunity to be heard
concerning such alleged violation. The notice shall specify the date, hour and
place of hearing and the hearing shall be private. If, after such hearing, the
health officer or other legally qualified authority shall believe the ordinance
or regulation has been violated, he or she shall cause the party to be
prosecuted.
§ 2-110 CONTRACTUAL SERVICES.
   If the village enters into a cooperative public health agreement with
another municipality for health services, by contract approved by the board of
trustees, the personnel of that health department, including the health
officer, shall be considered officers and employees of the village.
ARTICLE V. BOARDS AND COMMISSIONS
Division 1. Board of Health
§ 2-111 CREATION; COMPOSITION.
   There is hereby created and established a board of health for the village.
This board shall consist of the president of the village, who shall be ex
officio a member of the board of health and the board of trustees.
§ 2-112 MEETINGS.
   The board of health shall meet at such times and places as it may determine.
§ 2-113 ATTENDANCE OF HEALTH OFFICER.
   The board of health may require the health officer to attend any of its
meetings, and to give to the board such information or advice as it may desire.
§ 2-114 RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   (a)   The board of health shall have the power to make reasonable rules and
regulations for the protection and betterment of the health of the residents of
the village, for the abatement of nuisances to health and for the prevention
and suppression of disease. Such rules and regulations shall take effect and be
in force ten days after publication in a newspaper of general circulation in
the village, except in cases of emergency as hereinafter provided for.
   (b)   In case of contagious or epidemic disease, or of danger from
anticipated or impending contagious or epidemic disease, or in case the
sanitary condition of the village shall be so dangerous as to warrant it, it
shall be the duty of the board of health to make such rules and regulations,
and to take such measures, and to do and order to be done and caused to be done
such acts for the preservation of the public health, though not herein or
elsewhere or otherwise specifically authorized, as it may in good faith believe
and declare the public safety and health demand.
   (c)   All such rules and regulations so declared by the board of health to
be emergency rules and regulations shall take effect immediately, or as soon as
may be, after the promulgation of the same by the board of health. Such
emergency rules and regulations shall also be published in such manner as the
board of health shall determine, with notice that they are in force in the
village.
§ 2-115 ENFORCEMENT OF ORDERS.
   It shall be the duty of every member of the health department, and of every
member of the police and fire departments, to aid in the enforcement of any
order issued by the board of health.
Division 2. Board of Local Improvements
§ 2-116 CREATION; COMPOSITION.
   There is hereby established a board of local improvements for the village,
which shall consist of the village president and the board of trustees.
§ 2-117 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The board of local improvements shall have such powers and duties as are or
may be given to it by the statutes of the state, the provisions of this code or
any other ordinance of the village.
§ 2-118 RECORDS.
   The board of local improvements shall keep adequate records of all work
undertaken by it, showing the work undertaken, the work accomplished, the
expenditures made and the amount of money received.
Division 3. Plan Commission
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
§ 2-119 CREATION; MEMBERSHIP.
   (a)   There is hereby established a plan commission for the village to be
known as the "Glencoe plan commission." The Glencoe plan commission shall have
all the powers set forth in this division of this code.
   (b)   (1)   The Glencoe plan commission shall consist of the following
members:
         A.   A member of the board of trustees of the village appointed by the
village president, upon approval of the board of trustees;
(Ord. No. 96-12-2008)
         B.   The chief executive of each of the following boards, as ex
officio members: Glencoe elementary school district board; Glencoe park
recreation district board; and Glencoe library board; provided, however, that,
if ever the chief executive of any such board is unable to attend a meeting of
the plan commission, that chief executive's designee from such board shall
serve on the plan commission in that chief executive's absence;
         C.   Four members from the citizens of the village at large appointed
by the village president, upon approval of the board of trustees;
         D.   One member from the zoning board of appeals appointed by the
village president, upon approval of the board of trustees; and
         E.   One member from the historic preservation commission appointed by
the village president, upon approval of the board of trustees.
      (2)   All members shall be residents of the village. The terms of the
members appointed from the zoning board of appeals and historic preservation
commission shall be coincident with their respective terms on such bodies. The
members appointed at large shall serve from the time of appointment until May 1
following a regular election for the of office of village president. The
members now serving shall continue to exercise all the powers and be subject to
all the duties of members during the balance of their respective terms of
office and until their successors are appointed and qualified. The village
president shall have the power to remove any member for cause and after a
public hearing. A vacancy that may occur shall be filled for the balance of the
unexpired term in the same manner as the original selection or appointment for
the remainder of the unexpired term in the same manner as the original
selection or appointment. All appointments of successors upon the expiration of
any term of any member shall be for the same period of time as the original
selection or appointment and until a successor has been appointed and has
qualified for office. All members of the plan commission shall serve without
compensation.
   (c)   The village president, upon approval of the board of trustees, shall
name one at large member of the plan commission as chairperson to preside at
all public meetings and hearings and to fulfill the customary functions of that
of office, and another member as vice chairperson. The chairperson and vice
chairperson may administer oaths. In the absence of the chairperson, the vice
chairperson or, in the absence of the vice chairperson, a temporary chairperson
designated by the members of the plan commission, shall act as chairperson and
shall have all the powers of the chairperson. The vice chairperson shall have
such other powers and duties as may from time to time be provided by thee rules
of the plan commission.
   (d)   The village manager shall designate a staff secretary of the plan
commission, who shall attend all meetings and perform all administrative and
recordkeeping duties of the plan commission.
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
§ 2-120 VOTING.
   (a)   No business shall be transacted by the plan commission without a
quorum, consisting of a majority of the members, being present. The concurring
vote of a majority of the members present shall be necessary on any motion to
approve any matter or any application. Any lesser vote on any such motion, even
if a majority of those voting, shall be considered a final decision to deny of
such matter or application. If less than a quorum is present, the public
hearing or meeting may be adjourned from time to time as provided in the
Illinois Open Meetings Act. The secretary shall in writing notify all members
of the date of the adjourned public hearing or meeting and shall also notify
such other interested parties as may be designated in the vote of adjournment.
   (b)   No member absent from any portion of a hearing shall be qualified to
vote upon the matter heard unless that member shall first certify on the record
that he or she has reviewed the entire record of any such portion of the
hearing during which he or she was absent and has fully informed himself or
herself of the essential facts and issues of the matter being heard so as to be
able to cast an informed and independent vote.
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
§ 2-121 MEETINGS; HEARINGS; PROCEDURES.
   (a)   Regular meetings of the plan commission shall be held in accordance
with the annual schedule posted in the manager's office when matters have been
placed on the agenda, and at such other times as the members of the plan
commission may determine.
   (b)   All meetings and hearings of the plan commission shall be open to the
public except when closed pursuant to the provisions of the Illinois Open
Meetings Act.
   (c)   The plan commission shall adopt its own rules of procedure for the
conduct of its business not inconsistent with this code and the statutes of the
State of Illinois.
   (d)   The transcript of testimony, if any; the minutes; all applications,
requests and papers filed in any proceeding before the plan commission; and the
decision and report, or reports, of the plan commission shall constitute the
record.
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
§ 2-122 DECISIONS AND REPORTS.
   (a)   Every decision of the plan commission upon an application filed
pursuant to this code shall be memorialized in a written resolution stating the
pertinent facts, evidence or considerations supporting the decision. Every
resolution shall expressly set forth any limitations or conditions recommended
or imposed by the plan commission. Such resolution may be incorporated into the
minutes of the plan commission.
   (b)   The plan commission may take final action on any decision pertaining
to an application pending before it prior to the preparation of a written
resolution, but in such event it shall, before taking such action, first state
its findings and conclusions as above required at a meeting open to the public.
The plan commission's decision shall be deemed made as of the date of the
taking of such final action. The written resolution incorporating such findings
and conclusions shall be presented and approved at the next regular public
meeting of the plan commission.
   (c)   As to other matters brought before the plan commission, the plan
commission shall prepare such report as it shall deem appropriate to the
subject matter.
   (d)   No member of the plan commission shall participate in the hearing or
disposition of any matter in which that member has an interest. Any conflict of
interest prohibited by the Glencoe village code or state law shall disqualify a
member.
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
§ 2-123 COMPREHENSIVE PLAN.
   (a)   The Glencoe plan commission shall have the power to prepare and
recommend to the board of trustees a comprehensive plan of public improvements
looking to the present and future development of the village, which plan, after
its adoption by the board of trustees, shall be known as the official plan of
the village. Such plan may include reasonable requirements in reference to
streets, alleys and public grounds in unsubdivided land within the village or
in contiguous territory not more than one and one-half miles beyond the
corporate limits and not included in any city, village or incorporated town.
Such requirements shall be effective whenever such lands shall be subdivided
after the adoption of such plan.
   (b)   The Glencoe plan commission also shall prepare and recommend to the
board of trustees from time to time changes in the official plan; prepare and
recommend to the board of trustees from time to time plans for specific
improvements in pursuance of such of fiscal plans; give aid to the officials of
the village charged with the direction of projects for improvement embraced
within the official plan; further the making of such improvements, and shall
generally promote the realization of official plans and exercise such other
powers, germane to the powers granted by the statute, as may be conferred by
the board of trustees.
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
§ 2-124 MAPS AND PLATS OF SUBDIVISIONS.
   No map or plat of any subdivision presented for record affecting land within
the village or within contiguous territory which is not more that one and one-
half miles beyond the corporate limits of the village and not included in any
city, village or incorporated town, after the adoption of the fiscal plan,
shall be entitled to record or shall be valid unless the subdivision provides
for streets, alleys and public grounds in conformity with the applicable
requirements of the official plan and the subdivision regulations of the
village.
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
§ 2-125 RECORDS.
   The Glencoe plan commission shall keep written records of its proceedings
which shall be open to inspection by the board of trustees at all times.
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
§ 2-126 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   In addition to the powers and duties conferred on it by state statutes and
other codes and ordinances of the village, the plan commission shall have the
following powers and duties:
   (a)   To aid and assist the board of trustees and the departments of the
village in implementing general plans and in planning, developing and
completing specific projects;
   (b)   To review and report on any matters referred to it by the board of
trustees of the village manager;
   (c)   Upon reasonable written request, to make its special knowledge and
expertise available to any official, department, board or commission of the
village, county, state or federal governments to aid them in the performance of
their respective duties relating to the planning and development of the village
and its region; and
   (d)   To exercise such other powers, germane to the powers granted by this
code and state statute, as may be conferred by the board of trustees.
(Ord. No. 94-15-1951; Ord. No. 92-33-1899)
Division 4. Glencoe Sustainability Task Force
§ 2-127 ESTABLISHED; PURPOSE; DUTIES.
   (a)   There is hereby established a body that shall be known as the Glencoe
Sustainability Task Force ("GSTF").
   (b)   It shall be the intent and purpose of the GSTF to be a recommending
body with the following goals:
      (1)   To promote the conservation of natural resources and the
environment;
      (2)   To encourage environmentally sound and economically viable
practices for the maintenance of buildings, landscape, and structures in
residential, commercial, and public areas of the village; and
      (3)   To serve as a resource to the Village Board and the community
through environmental awareness programs and initiatives.
   (c)   The GSTF's duties shall consist of, but are not limited to, the
following:
      (1)   Sponsor awareness programs and pilot projects that encourage the
public to develop environmental sustainability measures that enhance health and
safety, reduce the consumption of energy and fossil fuels, conserve water,
reduce hazardous and solid waste, and reduce air pollution emissions;
      (2)   Reinforce alliances with sustainability organizations in order to
learn from, collaborate with, and share information;
      (3)   Explore grants and alternative funding to support the goals of the
GSTF, including but not limited to energy efficiency and cycling/walking
transit network improvements;
      (4)   Encourage collaboration and resource sharing between local
organizations, businesses, schools, and other agencies to partner in
sustainability initiatives that improve efficiencies;
      (5)   Encourage multi-agency initiatives to link local and regional bike/
pedestrian paths;
      (6)   Provide reviews of the Village Code, when directed, to remain
current with green building technologies and initiatives, making
recommendations for potential changes;
      (7)   Actively maintain and update the established sustainability portion
on the village website;
      (8)   Engage and participate in various studies as directed by the
Village Board; and
      (9)   Perform such other duties and functions as may be requested by the
Village Board.
(Ord. No. 2022-16-3536)
§ 2-128 ORGANIZATION AND MEMBERSHIP.
   The maximum number of members of the GSTF shall be set by the Village Board
by resolution duly adopted. The Village President and Board of Trustees, in
appointing members to the GSTF, shall consider benefits to the village and its
residents of having members whose training, interest, background or experience
will aid the Task Force in its work.
   (a)   The Village President, with the consent of the Board of Trustees,
shall appoint all members and the chair of the GSTF. The chair shall set the
meeting agenda and shall preside over each meeting of the GSTF. All vacancies
shall be filled by appointment by the Village President, with the consent of
the Board of Trustees, for the unexpired term. Any member may be removed by the
Village President without hearing for failure to attend three consecutive
meetings, or otherwise for cause after a public hearing.
   (b)   Each member of the GSTF shall be a resident of the village and shall
serve without compensation. Any appointed member who ceases to be a resident
will be deemed to have resigned from the GSTF.
   (c)   The term of office of each member shall be for three years. If the
Village Board reduces the membership of the GSTF by resolution duly adopted,
the reduction will not serve to terminate any current member's term. All
members whose terms continue beyond the date which the reduction becomes
effective shall continue in office until the end of their term. Any reduction
in membership may only be effectuated through the natural expiration of terms
or resignations of members.
   (d)   The Village Manager shall staff the GSTF with a secretary, who shall
be a village employee. The secretary shall take minutes of each meeting and
distribute copies of the official minutes to the Village President, Board of
Trustees, Village Manager/Clerk and the GSTF members, and shall assist the GSTF
in preparing its annual report and other reports as necessary.
   (e)   Expenses for the operation and conduct of the affairs of the GSTF
shall be paid from funds provided for that purpose in the annual appropriation
ordinance and annual budget of the village, or as otherwise specifically
approved by the Board of Trustees.
(Ord. No. 2022-16-3536)
§ 2-129 RULES AND PROCEDURES.
   (a)   The GSTF shall meet at least quarterly on a day and time designated by
it and may meet at other times upon the request of the Village President or the
chair, or any two members of the GSTF. The facilities of the Village Hall shall
be available to the GSTF for its meetings.
   (b)   The GSTF may adopt rules of order and procedure as it may deem
necessary and advisable. These rules and procedures may be changed or altered
as shall be consistent with village ordinances and other applicable laws.
   (c)   A majority of the currently appointed members of the GSTF shall
constitute a quorum for the purpose of transacting business, notwithstanding
the number of open seats on the GSTF. Any action or recommendation shall
require the affirmative vote of a majority of members in attendance.
   (d)   Each member of the GSTF shall have one vote and the chair shall have
the right to vote on all matters coming before the GSTF.
   (e)   All meetings of the GSTF shall be open to the public. The GSTF shall
keep written records of its proceedings, which shall be open to public
inspection as required under the Illinois Open Meetings Act.
   (f)   The GSTF, through its chair or other designated member, shall report
at least annually in writing to the Board of Trustees and the Village Manager,
and at such additional times as requested by the Village President. The annual
report shall cover the activities of the GSTF for the preceding calendar year.
(Ord. No. 2022-16-3536)
Division 5. Electrical Commission
§ 2-130 CREATION; COMPOSITION; APPOINTMENT AND TERM OF MEMBERS.
   (a)   There is hereby created an electrical commission which shall consist
of five members, as follows:
      (1)   The chief electrical inspector shall be a member and ex officio
chairperson of such commission;
      (2)   Of the other four members:
         A.   One shall be an electrical contractor;
         B.   One a journeyman electrician;
         C.   One a representative of an inspection bureau maintained by the
fire underwriters (or, if no such representative resides in the village, then
the chief of the fire department); and
         D.   One a representative of an electrical supply company.
   (b)   Such members shall be appointed for one year by the president and
board of trustees.
§ 2-131 FUNCTIONS.
   The electrical commission shall recommend safe and practical standards and
specifications for the installation, alteration and use of electrical equipment
designed to meet the necessities and conditions that prevail in this village,
shall recommend reasonable rules and regulations governing the issuance of
permits by the electrical inspectors and shall recommend reasonable fees to be
paid for the inspection by such inspectors of all electrical equipment
installed or altered within this village; provided, that such standards and
specifications, such rules and regulations and such fees shall not become
effective until adopted by ordinance by the board of trustees.
Division 6. Playground Commission
§ 2-132 ESTABLISHED; POWERS AND DUTIES GENERALLY.
   (a)   There is hereby established a committee or commission which shall be
known as the municipal playground commission.
   (b)   The playground commission shall have the power, and it shall be a part
of its duties to investigate, formulate, promote and provide playgrounds and
areas or places for general outdoor and indoor sports and amusements, which
shall be open to the residents and citizens of the village under such
conditions as may hereafter be provided.
   (c)   For such purposes, the commission may receive, acquire, use and
disburse monies, funds or properties as specified in this division. It shall
also report quarterly each year to the board of trustees its acts and doings,
and semiannually shall submit a detailed financial statement of its receipts
and disbursements.
§ 2-133 COMPOSITION.
   The playground commission shall consist of seven members, who shall be the
village president and the board of trustees.
(Ord. No. 66-7-1440, § 1)
§ 2-134 REPEALED.
(Ord. No. 66-7-1440, § 2)
§ 2-135 OFFICERS.
   The village president shall serve as chairperson, the village treasurer
shall serve as treasurer and the village clerk shall serve as secretary of the
playground commission; the playground commission shall appoint such other
officers as the commission shall consider proper and necessary. Their terms of
office shall be determined by the playground commission and the rules
established by it. The officers shall have the usual powers and duties
pertaining to their respective offices.
(Ord. No. 66-7-1440, § 3)
§ 2-136 RULE MAKING POWERS; OTHER POWERS ENUMERATED.
   (a)   The playground commission shall have power to formulate, arrange,
change and enforce the rules and regulations for the uses, employment,
improvement and disposition of any of the property rights or privileges which
such commission may acquire, use, control, possess or establish; may form rules
and regulations as to fees, charges and uses thereof; formulate associations of
members, classes or other bodies in such manner and form as to the commission
may be found appropriate and be by it determined.
   (b)   Such commission may for the purpose hereof acquire by gift, donation,
lease, permit, license or otherwise, properties, rights, privileges, uses or
franchises, which may be held in its name, or in the name of a trustee for it.
   (c)   It may receive monies contributed for general or special purposes
consistent with the purpose for which such commission is hereunder formulated
and empowered. It may employ from time to time assistants and employees and
provide for their compensation, and may enter into contracts for employment,
service, merchandise or other purposes.
§ 2-137 CONTRACTS, ETC.
   In any event, any contract or commitment of the playground commission
involving an expenditure of more than $100 shall provide, among other items,
the following:
   (a)   That payment shall be made only out of the funds of the commission
raised by subscription or otherwise;
   (b)   That the party to whom payments are to be made shall look only to such
funds for payment, and not to the officers or members of the commission, or to
the officers of the village individually, or to the village; and
   (c)   That they are made subject to, and to be governed by the provisions of
this article establishing the commission, and the amendments thereto, and the
roles of such commission.
§ 2-138 REPORTS; REPEAL OF DIVISION.
   (a)   From time to time the playground commission shall file with the
village president and board of trustees certified copies of all the plats,
surveys, engineers' estimates, reports, examinations, contracts relating to any
work or action undertaken by the commission and shall give the village complete
information thereof, as the exclusive property of the village.
   (b)   In the event this division is repealed, all funds and property
appropriated for the use of the commission by the village then in the hands of
the commission or its officers, unexpended, shall be paid or turned over to the
village treasurer within ten days after such repeal is effected, but such
repeal shall not thereby work a dissolution of the commission; provided, that
three fourths of all of the members of such commission shall thereupon elect to
continue such commission as a non-official organization.
Division 7. Public Safety Commission
§ 2-139 CREATION; COMPOSITION.
   In accordance with Division 2.1 of Article 10 of the Illinois Municipal
Code, Ill. Rev. Stat. ch. 24, §§ 10-2.1-1 et seq., there is hereby established
a board of fire and police commissioners consisting of three members which
shall be known in the Village of Glencoe as the public safety commission.
§ 2-140 APPOINTMENT; TERM.
   Members of the public safety commission shall be appointed by the village
president with the consent of the board of trustees. The terms of office of
members of the commission shall end at the end of the village fiscal year and
shall be three years and until their respective successors shall be appointed
and qualified; provided that:
   (a)   No appointment shall be made by the village president within 30 days
before the expiration of his or her term;
   (b)   The first appointments shall be for terms not to exceed one, two or
three years, respectively, and they shall serve such term until their
successors are appointed and qualified; and
   (c)   A vacancy on the commission shall be filled in the same manner as an
original appointment.
§ 2-141 QUALIFICATIONS; OATH; BOND; REMOVAL.
   The members of the public safety commission shall have such qualifications
as are now, or may here after be, required for members of boards of fire and
police commissioners by § 3 of Division 2.1 of Article 10 of the Illinois
Municipal Code, Ill. Rev. Stat. ch. 24, § 102.1-3 or its successor statutory
provision. Each member of the commission shall file an oath or affirmation of
office with the village and shall execute and deliver to the village a bond in
the sum of $1,000 with such surety as the village president and board of
trustees shall by motion or resolution approve, conditioned on the faithful
performance of the duties of his or her office. Members of the commission shall
be subject to removal in the manner provided for removal of members of boards
of fire and police commissioners in the aforesaid section of the Illinois
Municipal Code.
§ 2-142 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The public safety commission shall have such powers and duties as are now,
or may hereafter be, given to boards of fire and police commissioners in
accordance with Division 2.1 of Article X of the Illinois Municipal Code, Ill.
Rev. Stat. ch. 24, §§ 10-2.1-1 et seq., or its successor statutory provisions;
as supplemented by the ordinances and code of the Village of Glencoe.
(Ord. No. 82-18-1659; Ord. No. 2024-05-3582)
§ 2-143 SECRETARY; DUTIES; COMPENSATION.
   The public safety commission may employ a secretary or designate one of its
own members to act as secretary. The duties of the secretary shall include
those described in § 20 of Division 2.1 of Article 10 of the Illinois Municipal
Code, Ill. Rev. Stat. ch. 24, § 10-2.1-20 or its successor statutory
provisions. If the commission employs a secretary, the compensation of that
secretary shall be fixed by the village manager with the approval of the board
of trustees.
§ 2-144 MEMBERS TO SERVE WITHOUT COMPENSATION.
   Members of the public safety commission shall serve without compensation.
Division 8. Joint Emergency Telephone System Board
(Ord. No. 2017-2-3410)
§ 2-145 AUTHORIZATION.
   There is hereby authorized a joint emergency telephone system board that
shall be established pursuant to an intergovernmental agreement approved by a
duly adopted resolution of the village's corporate authorities.
(Ord. 2017-2-3410)
§ 2-146 RESERVED.
Division 9. Glencoe Council for Inclusion and Community
§ 2-146.1 CREATION.
   There is created a Council that shall be known as the Glencoe Council for
Inclusion and Community.
(Ord. No. 97-8-2031; Ord. No. 2014-16-3368; Ord. No. 2021-15-3511)
§ 2-146.2 PURPOSE OF COUNCIL.
   The Council is being created in recognition of the village's commitment to
fostering and maintaining a strong sense of community and to acknowledge the
value of diversity and inclusion within the Glencoe community. In furtherance
of this purpose, the Council shall promote and further the village's strong
public policy against discrimination, bigotry, bias, or hate in any form and
shall encourage mutual respect, cooperation, tolerance and understanding among
those who live, work, visit or do business in the village, regardless of race,
color, immigration or refugee status, national origin, ancestry, religion or
creed, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, cognitive or physical
ability, veteran status, marital status, parental status, socioeconomic status,
source of income, housing status, or any other social identities. The functions
and duties of the Council shall be to engage in the following activities, when
so directed by the Village Board or, if the Council otherwise believes such
activities are appropriate:
   (a)   Act in an advisory capacity to the Village President and Board of
Trustees on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives within the village and
upon such specific matters as may be requested by the Village President or
Board of Trustees;
   (b)   Provide a public forum for diversity, equity, and inclusion issues and
initiatives;
   (c)   The Council supports, facilitates, and promotes public participation
in community dialogue on the issues of racism and social equity, and to work
closely with cultural, civic, governmental, and faith-based organizations to
develop recommendations and actions on behalf of initiatives that foster a more
inclusive environment.
(Ord. No. 97-8-2031; Ord. No. 2021-15-3511)
§ 2-146.3 ORGANIZATION AND MEMBERSHIP.
   The maximum number of members of the Council shall be set by the Village
Board by resolution duly adopted. The Village President and Board of Trustees,
in appointing members to the Council, shall consider benefits to the village
and its residents of having members who reflect the diversity of the village
community and whose training, interest, background or experience will aid the
forum in its work.
   (a)   The Village President, with the consent of the Board of Trustees,
shall appoint all members and the chair of the Council. The chair shall set the
meeting agenda and shall preside over each meeting of the Council. All
vacancies shall be filled by appointment by the Village President, with the
consent of the Board of Trustees, for the unexpired term. Any member may be
removed by the Village President without hearing for failure to attend three
consecutive meetings, or otherwise for cause after a public hearing.
   (b)   Each member of the Council shall be a resident of the village and
shall serve without compensation. Any appointed member who ceases to be a
resident will be deemed to have resigned from the forum.
   (c)   The term of office of each member shall be for four years, not to
exceed two consecutive terms. If the Village Board reduces the membership of
the forum by resolution duly adopted, the reduction will not serve to terminate
any current member's term. All members whose terms continue beyond the date
which the reduction becomes effective shall continue in office until the end of
their term. Any reduction in membership may only be effectuated through the
natural expiration of terms or resignations of members.
   (d)   The Village Manager shall staff the forum with a secretary, who shall
be a village employee. The secretary shall take minutes of each meeting and
distribute copies of the official minutes to the Village President, Board of
Trustees, Village Manager/Clerk and the Council members, and shall assist the
Council in preparing its annual report and other reports as necessary.
   (e)   Expenses for the operation and conduct of the affairs of the Council
shall be paid from funds provided for that purpose in the annual appropriation
ordinance and annual budget of the village, or as otherwise specifically
approved by the Board of Trustees.
(Ord. No. 97-8-2031; Ord. No. 2012-19-3320; Ord. No. 2020-19-3485; Ord. No.
2021-15-3511)
§ 2-146.4 RULES AND PROCEDURES.
   (a)   The Council shall meet at least quarterly on a day and time designated
by it and may meet at other times upon the request of the Village President or
the chairperson, or any two members of the Council. The facilities of the
Village Hall shall be available to the Council for its meetings.
   (b)   The Council may adopt rules of order and procedure as it may deem
necessary and advisable. These rules and procedures may be changed or altered
as shall be consistent with village ordinances and other applicable laws.
   (c)   A majority of the currently appointed members of the Council shall
constitute a quorum for the purpose of transacting business, notwithstanding
the number of open seats on the forum. Any action or recommendation shall
require the affirmative vote of a majority of members in attendance.
   (d)   Each member of the Council shall have one vote and the chair shall
have the right to vote on all matters coming before the Council.
   (e)   All meetings of the Council shall be open to the public. The Council
shall keep written records of its proceedings, which shall be open to public
inspection as required under the Illinois Open Meetings Act.
   (f)   The Council, through its chair or other designated member, shall
report at least annually in writing to the Board of Trustees and the Village
Manager, and at such additional times as requested by the Village President.
The annual report shall cover the activities of the Council for the preceding
calendar year.
(Ord. No. 97-8-2031; Ord. No. 2020-19-3485; Ord. No. 2021-15-3511)
ARTICLE VI. CODE OF ETHICS
(Ord. No. 06-01-3143)
Division 1. General Provisions
§ 2-147 POLICY AND PURPOSE.
   It is the policy of the village that its elected and appointed officers and
employees should, in all cases, exercise their judgment and perform their
duties for the sole benefit of the citizens of the village. They shall conduct
village business with integrity and impartiality, without allowing prejudice,
favoritism or the opportunity for personal gain to influence their decisions or
actions or to interfere with serving the public interest. To this end, all such
persons should avoid accepting or retaining any economic benefits or
opportunities that could impair or present an actual threat to the exercise of
independent judgment. It is further the policy of the village that all
appearances of impropriety should be avoided. The board of trustees hereby
determines that a policy setting forth ethical principles and regulations
applicable to officers and employees is in the best interests of the village
